jobDescription:
À propos de KOHO

L'objectif de KOHO est de permettre aux Canadiens de bâtir d'excellentes fondations financières au moyen de produits qui sont radicalement transparents et faciles à gérer. Notre parcours a débuté en 2014 et nous avons depuis créé une communauté de plus de 800 000 utilisateurs. Des investisseurs de premier plan du monde entier croient en notre vision et nous avons réussi à amasser plus de 320 M$ pour la concrétiser. Le collectif KOHO compte maintenant plus de 300 employés. Découvrez notre culture ici et apprenez-en plus sur notre équipe ici !

À propos du poste

KOHO est à la recherche d'analystes de données (de niveau intermédiaire et avancé) pour stimuler la croissance de l'entreprise au cours du trimestre et à long terme en appuyant la prise de décision sur les données et en identifiant les occasions d'accroître les résultats d’affaires à l’échelle de l’entreprise. Ce poste est fait pour vous si vous aimez automatiser les rapports, élaborer des tableaux de bord et analyser les données pour en tirer des renseignements exploitables. Vous passerez une grande partie de votre temps à écrire des requêtes SQL, à développer des scripts Python et à consulter les membres de l'équipe chargée de l'exploitation.

Ce que vous ferez
Vous étudierez les sources de données actuelles pour élaborer des rapports précis.Vous élaborerez et présenterez des tableaux de bord mettant en évidence les résultats et les tendances.Vous effectuerez des analyses approfondies sur des questions d'affaires dans votre domaine de compétence.Vous évaluerez et prioriserez les demandes de données entrantes dans votre flux de travail. Vous collaborerez avec d’autres membres de l’équipe des données sur des projets d’équipe et préserverez notre entrepôt de données en tant que source de vérité de KOHO.Vous collaborerez à l’échelle de l’entreprise en agissant à titre de conseiller de confiance pour les parties prenantes.

Qui vous êtes
Vous avez au moins deux années d’expérience dans un poste d’analyste de données (l’ancienneté dépend de l’expérience).Vous manipulez aisément des ensembles de données à l’aide de SQL (vous connaissez bien les connexions automatiques, les fonctions de fenêtre et les paramètres) et vous possédez des connaissances intermédiaires en Python (fonctions définies par l’utilisateur, création de requêtes d'API, rédaction de boucles efficaces).Vous possédez de solides compétences quantitatives et analytiques ainsi qu'en matière de collecte de données.Vous étudiez rapidement les concepts d'affaires, les mesures et les indicateurs clés de performance.Vous avez un sentiment d’appartenance et la capacité de mener plusieurs tâches de front et d'en établir les priorités.Vous êtes bien organisé et vous savez gérer votre temps.

Points bonis si vous avez de l'expérience ou de l'intérêt dans ce qui suit!
GitExpérience dans le domaine financier

Qu'est-ce Que Vous y Gagnerez?

Nous investissons du temps et des ressources pour nous assurer que KOHO est aussi efficace que les personnes que nous embauchons. Voici quelques-unes des raisons pour lesquelles nous attirons et conservons les meilleures personnes :
 Vie équilibrée: journées de bien-être estivales à l’échelle de l’entreprise, fermeture en hiver pendant les vacances du temps des Fêtes, nombre illimité de jours de congé pour des raisons personnelles, compte de dépenses pour le bien-être ainsi que congé de maternité et parental bonifié. Travail à distance: travaillez de n’importe où au Canada et disposez d’un budget pour installer votre bureau à domicile. Niveau supérieur: bénéficiez des conseils de trois coachs internes certifiés et d'un budget de formation annuel. Atteinte des objectifs: évaluations salariales deux fois par année. Culture de KOHO: nous avons remporté sept prix « Meilleurs lieux de travail » depuis 2019. Soyez propriétaire : chaque employé de KOHO reçoit un montant généreux d’actions avec une période d’exercice de 10 ans.

La culture de KOHO est une culture de collaboration, de créativité et de perspectives diverses. Nous sommes déterminés à créer et à favoriser un environnement inclusif et accessible pour tous. Si vous avez des questions, des préoccupations ou des demandes relatives aux besoins d'accessibilité, veuillez communiquer avec peopleaccessibility@koho.ca et l’équipe de Talent et culture se fera un plaisir de vous aider.

Prenez note qu'un niveau avancé d'anglais, tant à l'écrit qu'à l'oral, est requis pour ce poste, car votre supérieur immédiat sera un anglophone. De plus, le processus d'embauche se déroulera en anglais et nous vous fournirons du soutien en français, s'il y a lieu.

Votre travail portera sur les médias et l’industrie des communications, et vous fournirez des analyses et des observations sur les activités et les tendances de l’industrie. Vous développerez et appuierez des projets fondés sur les données, ainsi que des outils et des infrastructures afin de mesurer les habitudes de consommation des auditoires multiplateformes et leurs perceptions de CBC/Radio-Canada.

 Responsabilités 
 Élaborer des tableaux de bord institutionnels et d’autres outils libre-service automatisés de production de rapports en utilisant Excel et PowerBI, afin de faire ressortir des données importantes et des observations pour les parties intéressées. jobDescription:
Qualifications
Undergraduate degree in a relevant field (e.g., economics, business administration or policy)1+ years of experience with demographic or market analysis in CanadaFamiliarity with Canadian public sources of economic and demographic data, government data as well as other private sources of regional economic data (e.g., EMSI, IMPLAN, Moody’s)Analytical mindset with excellent problem solving skills High level of initiative and entrepreneurial driveAbility to interact effectively with stakeholders at all levels of an organizationExperience with business analytics tools (e.g., Alteryx, Tableau) is a plusExcellent oral and written communication skills French fluency is a plus 

What You'll Do

You will bring your experience and expertise to bear in many facets of the team’s work, but first and foremost you will support Canadian clients by providing data-backed insights into Canadian markets, consumers and industries. These insights will come through analyzing local market data, researching relevant topics,and your first-hand knowledge of Canada. You will use a combination of public data and private data in this work.

Your support to clients will usually take the form of working with McKinsey consulting teams. You will support these teams in their studies. You will do this in a range of ways – sometimes by answering one-off questions, sometimes by joining a consulting team for several weeks to own a more in-depth piece of their project, and other times by adapting models and assets built for the US to use in Canadian projects.

Examples of past projects include supporting a provincial government on an economic growth strategy by assessing regional competitiveness across different sectors; supporting a consumer product company’s marketing strategy by using demographic data to size consumer markets; and analyzing niche markets as inputs into a PE client’s target assessment. Projects also include sharing Canadian data and insights with consulting teams in other countries who want to use Canada as a benchmark.

The second aspect of your role will be to shape our assets and offerings for Canadian markets. You will do this by working closely with your managers to identify opportunities to build knowledge and assets to better support consultants. This could take the form of codified expertise, automated analysis in Tableau or standardized approaches to recurring questions.

Thirdly, as our first hires into Toronto, in many ways you will be the face of our team. You will interact with leaders in the office and region to raise awareness of the team’s new presence and the ways in which we can support their clients.

Who You'll Work With

You’ll work in our Toronto office as part of a research team that supports McKinsey’s clients by providing knowledge, analysis and insights on local Canadian markets.

The team is comprised of about 35 analysts who sit in Boston and San Jose, Costa Rica and support projects across the US and Canada. You will be the first wave of the team’s expansion into Toronto to better support Canadian clients and consulting teams with their research and analytic needs.

You will work closely with teammates in both San Jose and Boston who support Canadian clients today. Our Canadian client base spans multiple sectors (energy, financial services, consumer, public sector, etc.) and you will work with clients and consulting teams across each of those areas.

Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario. At Metrolinx, equity, diversity and inclusion are essential to living our values of serving with passion, thinking forward and playing as a team. Metrolinx has embarked on an exciting data governance journey and is looking for a Senior Enterprise Data Governance Analyst to help us mature our capabilities in metadata management, data quality, master and reference data, and open data. Reporting to the Director of Enterprise Data Governance in the Innovation & Information Technology Division, this is an excellent opportunity to be part of a team that is building and shaping the future of data governance at Metrolinx! Our team takes service excellence to heart and prides itself on quality – whether that be through the materials we produce, the guidance we provide, or in our interactions with colleagues. We are always striving to exceed expectations and are focused on continuous improvement. Your ability to build strong relationships will be key, as this role collaborates with data owners, stewards, and custodians across the organization to lead working groups, facilitate issue resolution, and influence adoption of data governance best practices. You will rely on your excellent writing and presentation skills to develop data governance policies, communicate updates on data governance activities, and deliver information sessions to increase awareness. In addition, your experience in data analytics and/or data governance will provide you with the technical expertise needed to help us create a comprehensive data catalogue, improve our data quality, and begin to master our data. If you’re passionate about data and making a meaningful difference to those that rely on it, we want to hear from you! What will I be doing?Lead, motivate and build positive working relationships with internal and external partners; continually improve professional expertise, knowledge transfer and be a brand ambassador for data governance.Support the development, maintenance, and ongoing evolution of data policies, processes, and standards and influence business units to adopt data governance best practices.Advise the business on the application of various data management directives including but not limited to metadata management, data quality, master data management, and open data.Support data stakeholders in developing and maintaining an enterprise data catalogue, including a business glossary and other associated metadata, by facilitating application of best practices, processes, and procedures.Work with data stewards, data engineers, and subject matter experts to establish data quality criteria and thresholds with the goal of improving data quality; collaborate with business and IT partners to find opportunities to improve data quality, maintain an enterprise data issues log, and ensure remediation efforts are prioritized and actioned in conjunction with the appropriate stakeholders. Work with data owners and data stewards to define data domains and improve master and reference data for business-critical data; perform support activities to establish data domain stewardship and accountability.Manage, monitor, and improve the open data assessment and approvals process by working with data owners/stewards and other business stakeholders to prepare, assess, and publish datasets under Ontario’s Digital and Data Directive.Capture business requirements for data governance tools (e.g., MDM, Data Quality Tools, Metadata Tools), assess and test potential tools, assist in deployment and training of selected tool, and ensure accurate and comprehensive testing of upgrades and enhancements made to any data governance tools. Collaborate with business to ensure that data-related business requirements for governing data are clearly defined, communicated, and well understood, and considered during project prioritization and planning.Lead and play an active role in coordinating, facilitating, and contributing to data working groups (e.g., Lead Data Steward Group, Open Data Assessment Team) to deliver a given mandate or resolve a data-related issues.Communicate and educate the business on the importance of data governance and the status of data governance initiatives by developing and presenting content through learning sessions, Yammer, and SharePoint.Prepare and deliver status updates on the EDG program by creating presentations and information notes; monitoring workstream project plans; tracking milestones and risks; and developing KPIs and metrics.

Please apply online directly to the posting . Applications should clearly demonstrate how your skills meet or surpass, the requirements of the position of Data Analyst. Further information about the Company can be found at www.flyflair.com

jobDescription:
Take a central role

The Bank of Canada has a vision to be “a leading central bank—dynamic, engaged and trusted—committed to a better Canada.” No other employer in the country offers you the unique opportunity to work at the very center of Canada’s economy, in a diverse and inclusive organization with significant impact on the economic and financial well-being of all Canadians. You will be challenged, energized and motivated to excel in an environment where we are reinventing central banking, renewing ways of doing business and reinforcing a culture of innovation.

Find out more about the next steps in our Recruitment process .

Did you know

Our Cyber team is always keeping an eye out for candidates who can contribute to our mission of keeping Canada’s economy safe & secure. To learn more about our mission, feel free to review our Cyber Security Strategy available to the public. There may be opportunities for temporary or full-time positions following the completion of this developmental assignment.

What You Will Do

The Cloud Security Analyst will also play a key role in the development of the Vulnerability Management process, as well as the Security Posture Reporting process. As Cloud Security Analyst, you will be responsible for:
 conducting ongoing vulnerability assessments of Bank technology, including cloud-based solutions or systems  proactively identifying security deficiencies, or other issues or gaps  validating and triaging any detected issues, and coordinating remediation activities with system owners and/or other stakeholders  providing support and guidance to various organizational stakeholders with regards to cloud security best practices, as well as on the implementation of Azure Policy recommendations  actively engaging with the Business, Infrastructure & Operational support teams, Cloud Services teams, and other stakeholders, to facilitate communication and to foster collaboration within ITS portfolios & Cyber Division  making adjustments or corrections to Azure policies when appropriate, ensuring the effective operation of the tool  participating in a forum of cloud security professionals, focusing on Azure Policy configurations as they apply to various Bank technology environments  contributing to the ongoing development of Bank policies, as well as the future state of both governance strategy and its roadmap.  producing operational vulnerability management reporting as well as security posture reporting on an ongoing basis  conveying valuable insights via reporting to help solve problems and inform management to allow business decisions 
This will also cover the responsibility for executing and supporting remediation governance initiatives, ensuring that the right processes and responsibilities are defined and enforced.

Specifically, You Will
 Use automated tools to extract policy information (vulnerabilities, recommendations, etc.) from primary and secondary cloud sources.  Perform analysis to assess data quality and meaning  Develop and maintaining reporting mechanisms (i.e., databases, data and reports)  Review security reports and indicators to identify and correct security problems  Use statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction  Prepare reports for Management stating security trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.  Work within Cyber and ITS portfolio’s SME to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies.  Prepare executive-level analysis to stakeholders, enabling them to make data driven decisions. 
What You Need To Succeed

The candidate must be passionate about cloud security governance and execution. The candidate must be able to communicate effectively with team members and have an understanding of data quality, data security, data movement, and data modeling.
 Good understanding of Cloud concepts and ecosystem (AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform).  Good understanding of the Vulnerability Management process  Good understanding of cybersecurity best practices as they pertain to cloud-based systems (PaaS, SaaS, IaaS)  Advanced knowledge of Excel – including pivots, lookups & macros.  Advanced knowledge of Data Analytics and visualization tools – including Power BI, Azure ecosystem. 
Nice-to-have 
 Experience with Defender for Cloud, Defender 365, Defender for Endpoint and/or Azure Policy.  Experience with Tanium or Rapid7’s InsightVM.  Experience with ServiceNow’s Vulnerability Response module.  Experience with various programming languages and/or scripting tools – Python, Java, PowerShell, etc.  Good understanding of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) concepts. 
Your Education And Experience
 This position requires a minimum of 1 year of Total IT experience as a Data Analyst, Business Analyst, Systems Analyst or other related roles.  Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related education. 
What You Need To Know
 Language requirement: English or French essential  Priority will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents  Security level required: Be eligible to obtain Secret  Please save a copy of the job poster.  Hybrid Work Model 

The Bank is conducting a trial of a hybrid working model which provides employees with the flexibility to telework for significant portions of each month. During the trial, employees will be expected to come onsite on those days when they are involved in activities that they or their leader feel are better conducted in person and to build connections with colleagues. For the majority of employees, it is expected that onsite time will range from 5 to 10 days per month, depending on your role. You must live in Canada, and within reasonable commuting distance of the office.

Detailed Overview

 Supporting the Vision, Values, Purpose and Commitments of Fraser Health including service delivery that is centered around patients/clients/residents and families. 

Provides information and data management expertise and analytical support for health assessment and disease surveillance functions. Partners with members of the Population Health Observatory and across Population and Public Health to generate and disseminate appropriate health information.

Responsibilities
Collects and collates regional health assessment and surveillance data; uses analytic reporting tools to retrieve data, design reports, and summarize health information; maintains routine surveillance reports and outputs; develops and produces regular and ad-hoc reports of key performance indicators that monitor trends and healthcare utilization to support decision-making. Acquires data from accessing on-line resources, requests data from other departments, regional, provincial and national agencies; assists as needed with the gathering and entering of data from health units and other frontline teams to ensure data collection and entry are complete. Facilitates the preparation of data requests by performing duties such as extracting, linking, manipulating, analyzing, and summarizing data at the request of internal and external partners such as medical health officers, directors, managers, and community partners for the purposes of program planning, quality improvement and performance measurement. Supports the epidemiologists in analysis of surveillance data for the preparation of reports and advises on data quality and data limitations for analytic purposes. Performs quantitative data analysis using descriptive and statistical methodologies, statistical software (e.g. SAS, R), and coding; automates routine analyses using standard programming tools; consults with epidemiologists and biostatistician to validate content and methodology of statistical reports. Performs data management and preparation activities, including data extraction, data cleaning and documentation; develops and maintains data collection and storage systems such as databases and spreadsheets, including designing ad hoc reports; automates routine data management tasks using standard programming tools including structured query language (SQL); partners with relevant stakeholders to ensure reporting needs are met for assigned databases. Uses ArcGIS, ArcCatalog and other relevant spatial software to create, organize and maintain geographic maps; uses cartography, geoprocessing, geocoding, vector and raster mapping, spatial joining, spatial editing, and Python and VBScript coding to conduct geospatial data analysis and create GIS maps; maintains appropriate metadata and documentation to describe maps, spatial analyses and processes and shapefiles; uses GIS maps, geospatial analysis, and spatial epidemiology of disease and its risk factors to assist in public health planning and evaluation, disease surveillance, outbreak investigations, and emergency preparedness.
